subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Building Trust: The Currency of Great Teams
description: A micro-lesson that makes Building Trust: The Currency of Great Teams usable.

hook.text: Google's Project Aristotle studied 180 teams. The top factor wasn't talentâ€”it was psychological safety.

buildup.text: Psychological safety means team members feel safe to take risks, admit mistakes, and speak up freely.

discovery.text: Trust is built through consistent small actions: keeping promises, sharing credit, admitting when you're wrong.

twist.text: One betrayal destroys more trust than a hundred good acts build. Trust is easy to lose, hard to earn.

climax.text: Ed Catmull built Pixar's culture by admitting his own mistakes firstâ€”signaling that vulnerability was safe.

punchline.text: Trust is built in drops and lost in buckets.
